quest.name: Signed, Sealed, to Be Delivered
journal: M'naago would like nothing more than to continue on to Castrum Oriens.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I'm pleased to report that the Empire is short three soldiersâ”€not that any self-respecting legatus would be sorry to lose them.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Right. I believe we've rested long enough. We should resume our journey before someone notices their missing patrol.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: More soldiers? I didn't think they'd come this far west, but better to be safe than sorry...

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: You said the forces at Castrum Oriens were under the command of Flame General Raubahn Aldynn, did you not?

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: By Rhalgr! The Bull of Ala Mhigo himself! I never dreamed I'd have a chance to meet the legend...

dialogue.name: PIPIN
dialogue.text: I returned from a survey of the Wall but a moment ago. We have yet to recover Papalymo's personal effects, I am sorry to say, but you may rest assured that we will notify you and yours the moment we do.

dialogue.name: PIPIN
dialogue.text: Our scouts recently informed me of an interesting development at Castellum Velodyna. Namely, the arrival of a shipment rumored to have come from the research and development facilities near the capital, containing prototype magitek armor.

dialogue.name: PIPIN
dialogue.text: It is our assessment that this armor is to be field-tested here, most likely against Alliance forces. Mayhap before the day is out.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Damn it all, more magitek weapons? That's the last thing we need!

dialogue.name: PIPIN
dialogue.text: Your concern is not unwarranted, but we needn't despair just yet. The shipment is thought to have contained a single heavy unit and one or two support units. With a well-laid ambush, we are confident we can destroy them all, hindering their development and delaying future deployment.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: And should we carry this out as a joint endeavor with the Resistance, they will have their rallying cry.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: It would mean dropping all pretense about the Alliance not wanting to go to war with the Empire...but you'd have a lot more folk willing to stand up and fight if they knew they weren't alone. And you were going to have to do it eventually anyway.

dialogue.name: PIPIN
dialogue.text: Exactly. And so what I propose is simple: we harry their patrols to bait them into bringing their prototype weapons to East End, where our Resistance allies will take them from behind.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Simple indeed, and well within our capabilities. I see no reason to delay, especially if a field test is imminent. What say you?

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Assuming the vice marshal's intelligence is accurate, I agree with his assessment and fully support his plan. I shall notify my comrades at once.

dialogue.name: PIPIN
dialogue.text: Understood. I shall have one of my men bring you the details of the plan anon.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: And we for our part will be fighting with the Alliance, yes? I somehow doubt you were intending to sit this one out.

obj.n: A Friend of a Friend in Need
What a Tangled Web We Weave
